Correspondence, speeches, articles, and copy of his history of the company entitled, "Song of Service; A Century of Consumers Power Company and Its Predecessors"; also include articles on history of Jackson County, Michigan; and photographs.

bioghist.p: E. Hardy Luther was born on August 25, 1898 in Grand Rapids, Michigan. After graduation from Jackson High School and the University of Michigan, Luther joined Consumers Power Company in 1921. He served as an assistant to the Division Manager of Pontiac from 1926 to 1943, at which time he was transferred to Kalamazoo. In 1951 Luther was promoted to General Training and Educational Supervisor, and in 1956 to General Personnel Development Supervisor.

In the 1940s, Luther became interested in the history of Consumers Power and began recording the recollections of past company employees. The result of his efforts was a company history entitled, "Song of Service: A Century of Consumers Power Company and Its Predecessors, 1856-1956." Luther also maintained an interest in the local history of Jackson and Kalamazoo. He wrote a history of St. Paul's Church in Jackson, and, as a member of the Jackson County Historical Society, gave numerous lectures on Jackson history and the history of electrical power in Michigan.

scopecontent.p: The papers of E. Hardy Luther reflect his life-long interest in Consumers Power and the local history of Jackson County. Luther's history of Consumer's Power, "Song of Service," comprises the bulk of the collection. The several inches of Luther's personal papers include correspondence, speeches, interviews, and unpublished articles relative to the development of electrical power in Michigan, management techniques of Consumers Power and the history of the Jackson Community in the 19th century.
